rev.diff:
Line 12: Line 12:
==''Star Trek: The Animated Series''==
==''Star Trek: The Animated Series''==
â
[[File:TAS title.jpg|thumb|235px|Title from ''[[Star Trek: The Animated Series]],'' showing Norway Corporation/Norway Productions credit.]]
 
In 1972, Roddenberry was approached by [[Filmation Studios]] about the possibility of an animated version of ''[[Star Trek]]'' for Saturday mornings. ''[[Star Trek: The Animated Series]]'' premiered on NBC television in 1973. Roddenberry delegated most production chores to [[D.C. Fontana]], who was credited as Associate Producer-Story Editor.<ref>Solow, Herbert F.; Justman, Robert H. (1996). "Inside Star Trek: The Real Story." New York: Pocket Books. ISBN 0671896288. p. 422.</ref> ''The Animated Series'' was a joint production between [[Filmation Associates]] and Norway Corporation, with Paramount Television also taking a hand in the production. The overall approach to the ''Animated Series'' was, essentially, to proceed with storytelling almost exactly as the company had with the original live-action production.
In 1972, Roddenberry was approached by [[Filmation Studios]] about the possibility of an animated version of ''[[Star Trek]]'' for Saturday mornings. ''[[Star Trek: The Animated Series]]'' premiered on NBC television in 1973. Roddenberry delegated most production chores to [[D.C. Fontana]], who was credited as Associate Producer-Story Editor.<ref>Solow, Herbert F.; Justman, Robert H. (1996). "Inside Star Trek: The Real Story." New York: Pocket Books. ISBN 0671896288. p. 422.</ref> ''The Animated Series'' was a joint production between [[Filmation Associates]] and Norway Corporation, with Paramount Television also taking a hand in the production. The overall approach to the ''Animated Series'' was, essentially, to proceed with storytelling almost exactly as the company had with the original live-action production.
